meaningMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
readingMnemonic: Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it should use the kun'yomi reading. When learning the kanji, you didn't learn that reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you with this word: Think about your <vocabulary>husband</vocabulary> even if you don't have one. What's his name? It's <reading>Otto</reading> (おっと), and he's always leaving you at home because he's working at the <reading>auto</reading> (おっと) shop.
